intro: Thlaspi corongianum, commonly known as the Cornish whitlow, is a low-growing flowering plant native to western Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has basal leaves that are oval to spoon-shaped and a flowering stem that bears clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats. Thlaspi corongianum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
